The android application-ReuserR is a bridging platform between the hard waste disposer and seeker. Its chief intention is the advocacy for a greener earth. This objective is achieved in two-fold:\n 1. Increasing hard waste reuse through the network of local residences before ending up in the landfill; thereby not only providing people with the means to contribute to the community but also offering Melbournians with a means of accessing items that are still in good condition.\n 2. Promoting awareness on the importance of reusing hard waste through interactive educational material and multilingual support; with Mandarin being included “out of the box”.

The city of Monash is one of the most culturally rich councils in Melbourne, according to ABS’ (Australian Bureau of Statistics) 2016 census, it is home to almost 90,000 residents who were born overseas, this accounts for almost 49% of the population who are now calling Monash their new home. For example: 39.5% in Clayton, 28.6% in Notting Hill are attending university (compared to 6.4% across Melbourne). Immigrants from an assortment of backgrounds (12.5% from China, 5.3% from India, 3.6% from Sri Lanka and more) This cultural diversity brings an exciting but unprecedented challenge in the field of hard waste. According to the local government’s official records, the resources devoted to the management of hard waste has been increasing steadily over the years. In 2016, it collected 5,030 tonnes of hard waste (with only a 20% diversion rate), which required $1,030,000 in expenditure for its proper management.
